meanings.definition: To change from a liquid to a vapor
meanings.sent1: The water was evaporating quickly under the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: I watched the puddle evaporating into thin air.
meanings.sent3: The spilled juice seemed to be evaporating like magic.
meanings.sent4: Her worries were evaporating as she focused on the present moment.
meanings.sent5: The steam rising from the pot showed the water evaporating before our eyes.

meanings.sent1: The hope of finding the lost toy was evaporating with each passing minute.
meanings.sent2: His smile slowly evaporated as he heard the bad news.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the room was evaporating like a popped balloon.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was evaporating faster than ice cream on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The joy of the celebration was evaporating into the night.

meanings.definition: The process of turning into vapor
meanings.sent1: The evaporating of the water created a misty atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent2: We observed the evaporating of the liquid as it transformed into a gas.
meanings.sent3: The sudden evaporating of the lake puzzled the scientists.
meanings.sent4: The slow evaporating of the fog revealed the sunrise behind it.
meanings.sent5: The gradual evaporating of the clouds allowed the sun to shine through.
